summary: This bill, the Agricultural Biorefinery Innovation and Opportunity Act of 2025, amends the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 to improve support for biorefineries, renewable chemicals, and biobased product manufacturing. It introduces grants on a competitive basis for pilot/demonstration-scale biorefineries. The bill outlines selection criteria for these grants, including feasibility, scoring system considerations (market, financial participation, innovativeness, impact on resource conservation, etc.), and cost-sharing limits.  It also allocates funding over several fiscal years.
